column2: CALIFORNIA PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
column4: California

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Arrows on the roadway:
column4: indicate reserved lanes.
column8: show which lanes you must use.

column2: 2. Drivers often fail to see a motorcycle headed toward them. Why?
column4: It is difficult to judge a motorcycle's speed.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 3. You reach an intersection with stop signs on all four corners at the same time as the driver on your left. Who has the right-of way?
column4: You.
column8: Whoever is signaling to make a turn.

column2: 4. What should you do if one of your tires blows out?
column4: Hold the steering wheel tight and brake immediately to avoid the risk of skidding.
column8: Hold the steering wheel tight and slowly take your foot off the gas pedal.

column2: 5. At intersections, crosswalks, and railroad crossings, drivers should always:
column4: stop, listen for oncoming traffic, and proceed with caution.
column8: look to the sides of their vehicle.

column2: 6. Never park your vehicle within __ feet of a fire hydrant.
7. Service signs are ____ with ____ letters and symbols.
column4: white; black
column8: blue; white

column2: 8. ___________ are green with white letters and symbols.
column4: Regulation signs (regulatory signs)
column8: Destination signs (guide signs)

column2: 9. When approaching any intersection or driveway, drivers should:
column4: pass other vehicles and then stop.
column6: look both ways and be ready to stop.
column8: drive at the fastest speed just before entering the intersection.

column2: 10. It is illegal for a person 21 years of age or older to drive with a BAC of _______ or higher.
11. Which shape is a yield sign?
column4: Vertical rectangle
column8: Upside-down triangle

column2: 12. Which of these statements is true about work zones?
column4: Slow down only if you think workers are present.
column6: You must “Slow down for the Cone Zone”.
column8: Fines are the same for violations committed in work zones.

column2: 13. If traffic on the other side of an intersection is backed up and you cannot get completely through, you must:
column4: enter the intersection and proceed with caution.
column6: wait until traffic ahead is clear.
column8: enter the intersection and try to avoid blocking it.

column2: 14. At 35 mph, it takes about ____ feet to react and bring the vehicle to a complete stop.
15. When planning to pass another vehicle you should:
column4: not count on other drivers making room for you.
column6: assume they will maintain a constant speed.
column8: assume they will let you pass if you use your turn signal.

column2: 16. Which signs have black letters on a white background?
column4: Guide signs (horizontal rectangle)
column8: Regulatory signs (vertical rectangle)

column2: 17. To see vehicles in your blind spots, you should check:
column4: the outside rearview mirror.
column8: the inside rearview mirror.

column2: 18. When driving a vehicle with air bags, you are safest when seated:
column4: with your head positioned directly above the steering wheel.
column6: at least 10 inches away from the steering wheel.
column8: within 6½ inches of the steering wheel.

column2: 19. The difference between traffic lights with red arrows and those with solid red lights is:
column4: Red arrows are only used for limited-access lanes.
column6: Red arrows are only used to stop vehicles turning left.
column8: Drivers cannot turn on a red arrow, even if they stop first.

column2: 20. What should you do if a vehicle is approaching head-on in your lane?
column4: Turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.
column6: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other driver.
column8: Pull over to the left and use your emergency lights to stop the other driver.

column2: 21. You are stopped at a stop sign and you are going to go straight through the intersection. A car on the cross road has stopped at a stop sign on your right and is going to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
column4: You.
column8: Whoever enters the intersection first.

column2: 22. If you get on a wrong freeway exit, you must:
column4: drive in reverse to return to the freeway.
column6: get off at the next exit and look for signs that tell you how to return to the freeway.
column8: use the the exit ramp to accelerate to freeway speed and blend with traffic.

column2: 23. This road sign tells drivers that:
column4: the one-way street or roadway ahead ends.
column8: they must turn either to the right or left.

column2: 24. After parking, are you allowed to open a door on the road side of your vehicle?
column4: Yes, always.
column8: Yes, but only if it does not interfere with bicyclists and other traffic.

column2: 25. You are waiting to turn at a red traffic light. There is a pedestrian on the right side of your vehicle waiting to cross the street you want to enter. Who has the right-of-way when the light turns green?
column4: You have the right-of-way because your light is green.
column6: You have the right-of-way only if the crosswalk is not marked.
column8: The pedestrian has the right-of-way.

column2: 26. You should usually drive your vehicle more carefully when you:
column4: want to look at a controlled collision scene.
column6: pass large trucks on the freeway.
column8: are near schools, playgrounds, and in residential areas.

column2: 27. What can you do to prevent skids on snow and ice?
column4: Brake early and gently.
column6: Allow the wheels to keep turning.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 28. It is illegal to leave a child age six or younger unattended in a vehicle on a hot day:
column4: only when the vehicle is parked in a restricted area.
column6: even if the child is secured in a child passenger restraint system.
column8: if the child is supervised by a person twelve years of age or older.

column2: 29. Which sign has white letters on a red background?
column4: Yield
column8: School zone

column2: 30. Always look carefully for motorcycles before you make a turn because:
column4: their smaller size makes them harder to see.
column6: they always have the right-of-way at intersections.
column8: they must have a full traffic lane.

column2: 31. A red traffic sign means?
column4: Stop.
column8: Construction warning.

column2: 32. You are crossing an intersection and an emergency vehicle is approaching with a siren and flashing lights. You should:
column4: continue through the intersection, pull to the right, and stop.
column6: stop immediately in the intersection until it passes.
column8: pull to the right in the intersection and stop.

column2: 33. Which of the following blocks the smooth flow of traffic?
column4: Using public transportation instead of your vehicle.
column8: Slowing down to look at a collision scene.

column2: 34. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.
column6: left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column8: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.

column2: 35. When parked on any hill, always set your parking brake and:
column4: keep your front wheels parallel to the road.
column6: leave your vehicle in gear or the “park” position.
column8: leave your vehicle in neutral.

column2: 36. Bicyclists must:
column4: remain near the left edge of the road.
column6: remain to the right when they prepare for a left turn.
column8: ride in a bicycle lane, if available.
